metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12499 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Firejail before 0.9.60 allows truncation (resizing to length 0) of thefirejail binary on the host by running exploit code inside a firejailsandbox and having the sandbox terminated. To succeed, certain conditionsneed to be fulfilled: The jail (with the exploit code inside) needs to bestarted as root, and it also needs to be terminated as root from the host(either by stopping it ungracefully (e.g., SIGKILL), or by using the--shutdown control command). This is similar to CVE-2019-5736.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firejail - 0.9.60-2
firejail-profiles - 0.9.60-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firejail package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.60-2').
